gurmukhi: ੳੂਚੇ ਦ੍ਰੁਮ ਸਾਲ ਜਹਾਂ ਲਾਂਬੇ ਬਟ ਤਾਲ ਤਹਾਂ ਅੈਸੀ ਠੳੁਰ ਤਪ ਕੱੳੁ ਪਧਾਰੈ ਅੈਸੋ ਕੳੁਨ ਹੈ ||
transliteration: Ooche Droum Saal Jahaan Laanbe Bat Taal Tahaan Aisithaur Tap Kau Padhdarai Aiso Kaoun Hai||
translation: Where there are high saal trees and Banyan trees and the large tanks, who is the person who performs austerities;

gurmukhi: ਜਾਕੀ ਛਬ ਦੇਖ ਦੁਤ ਪਾਂਡਵ ਕੀ ਫੀਕੀ ਲਾਗੈ ਅਾਭਾ ਤਕੀ ਨੰਦਨ ਬਿਲੋਕ ਭਜੇ ਮੌਨ ਹੈ ||
transliteration: Jaakichhab Dekh Dout Paandav Kipheekilaagad Aabhaa Takinandan Bilok Bhaje Maoun Hain
translation: And seeing whose beauty, the beauty of Pandavas seems devoid of radiance and the forests of heaven feel it better to keep silent on observing his beauty?

gurmukhi: ਤਾਰਨ ਕੀ ਕਹਾ ਨੈਕ ਨਭ ਨ ਨਿਹਰਾਯੋ ਜਾੲਿ ਸੂਰਜ ਕੀ ਜੋਤ ਤਹਾਂ ਚੰਦ੍ਰਕੀ ਨ ਜੳੁਨ ਹੈ ||
transliteration: Taaran Kikahaa Naik Nabh Na Nihraayo Jaae Sooraj Kijot Tahaan Channdrakina Jaoun Hai||
translation: There is so much dense shade there that not to speak of the stars, the sky is also not seen there, the light of the sun and moon does not reach there.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵ ਨ ਨਿਹਾਰਯੋ ਕੋੳੂ ਦੈਤ ਨ ਬਿਹਾਰਯੋ ਤਹਾਂ ਪੰਛੀ ਕੀ ਨ ਗੰਮ ਜਹਾਂ ਚੀਟੀ ਕੋ ਨ ਗੳੁਨ ਹੈ ||੩੦੦||
transliteration: Dev Na Nihdaryo Ko( i)  Dait Na Bihdaryo Tahaan Paaachhikina Gadm Jahaan Cheetiko Na Gaddd Hai||300||
translation: No god or demon lives and the birds and even an ant has no access there.300.

gurmukhi: ਲਖੀੲੇ ਅਲੱਖ || ਤਕੀੲੇ ਸੁਭੱਛ || ਧਾਯੋ ਬਿਰਾਧ || ਬੰਕੜਯੋ ਬਿਬਾਦ ||੩੦੧||
transliteration: Lakheee Alakkh|| Takeee Soubhachchh|| Dhaayo Biraadh|| Bankadyo Bibaad||301||
translation: Seeing the ignorant persons )Ram-Laksman) as good food, a demon named Viradh came forwards and in this way there came a calamitous situation in their peaceful lives.301.

gurmukhi: ਲਖੀਅੰ ਅਵੱਧ || ਸੰਬਹਯੋ ਸਨੱਧ || ਸੰਮਲੇ ਹਥਿਅਾਰ || ੳੁਰੜੇ ਲੁਝਾਰ ||੩੦੨||
transliteration: Lakheean Avaddh|| Sanbahyo Sanaddh|| Sanmle Hathiaar|| Urade Lujhaar||302||
translation: Ram saw him and holding his wapons he went towards him; keeping control of their weapons both the warriors began their battle.302.

gurmukhi: ਚਿਕੜੀ ਚਾਵੰਡ || ਸੰਮੁਹੇ ਸਾਵੰਤ || ਸੱਜੀੲੇ ਸੁੱਬਾਹ || ਅੱਛਰੋ ੳੁਛਾਹ ||੩੦੩||
transliteration: Chikadichaavand|| Sanmuhe Saanvant|| Sajjeee Soubbaah|| Achchhro Ouchhaad||303||
translation: The vultures shirked and the warriors faced each other. They were bedecked nicely and there was unending zeal in them.303.

gurmukhi: ਪੱਖਰੇ ਪਵੰਗ || ਮੋਹਲੇ ਮਤੰਗ || ਚਾਵਡੀ ਚਿੰਕਾਰ || ੳੁਝਰੇ ਲੁਝਾਰ ||੩੦੪||
transliteration: Pakkhre Pavan|| Mohle Matan|| Chaavadichinkaar|| Ujhre Lujhaar||304||
translation: There were horses and intoxicated elephants bedecked with armours. The shrieks of the vultures were heard and the warriors were seen entangled with each other.304.

gurmukhi: ਸਿੰਧਰੇ ਸੰਧੂਰ || ਬੱਜੲੇ ਤੰਦੂਰ || ਸੱਜੀੲੇ ਸੁੱਬਾਹ || ਅੱਛਰੋ ੳੁਛਾਹ ||੩੦੫||
transliteration: Sinddare Sandhoor|| Bajjae Tandoor|| Sajjeee Soubbaah|| Achchhdaro Ouchhaad||305||
translation: The elephants serene like sea were there and the trumpets were resounding, the long-armed warriors with unparalleled enthusiasm looked impressive.305.

gurmukhi: ਬਿੱਝੁੜੇ ੳੁਝਾੜ || ਸੰਮਲੇ ਸੁਮਾਰ || ਹਾਹਲੇ ਹੰਕਾਰ || ਅੰਕੜੇ ਅੰਗਾਰ ||੩੦੬||
transliteration: Bijjhude Ujhaar|| Sanmale Soumaar|| Haahale Hankaar|| Ankade Anadr||306
translation: The warriors who never fell began to fall and also regain their control; there were egoistic attacks from all the four sides and the warriors blazed like embers.306.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਮਲੇ ਲੁੱਝਾਰ || ਛੁੱਟਕੇ ਬਿਸਿਯਾਰ || ਹਾਹਲੇਹੰ ਬੀਰ || ਸੰਘਰੇ ਸੁ ਬੀਰ ||੩੦੭||
transliteration: Sanmale Lujjhaar|| Chhouttke Bisiyaar|| Haahlehan Beer|| Sandare Su Beer||307||
translation: The warriors were keeping their control and the weapons began to slip away from their hands like serpents.307.

gurmukhi: ਗਜੰ ਗਜੇ ਹਯੰ ਹਲੇ ਹਲਾ ਹਲੀ ਹਲੋ ਹਲੰ || ਬਬੱਜ ਸਿੰਧਰੇ ਸੁਰੰ ਛੁਟੰਤ ਬਾਣ ਕੇਵਲੰ ||
transliteration: Gadan Gade Hayan Hale Halaa Halihalo Halan|| Babajj Sinddare Suran Chhoutant Baan Kevalan||
translation: The horses began to move and elephant roared, there was confusion on all the four-sides, the musical instruments resounded and the harmonious sound of the discharge of arrows was heard;
